definition: enemy/to be a match for/to rival/to resist/to withstand
having wealth equivalent to that of an entire nation (idiom)/extremely wealthy

sentences.english: So the invasion from an enemy country irritated an Italian scientist.
sentences.chinese: 因此來自一個敵國的入侵激怒了一名意大利的科學家。

sentences.english: Rests in the ring, the rich can be the enemy, river's lake as the tomb of king.
sentences.chinese: 威名響四海，富甲可敵國，江湖稱其爲墓王派。

sentences.english: The conquerors depopulated the enemy's country by destruction and expulsion.
sentences.chinese: 征服者用毀滅和驅逐的方法來減少敵國的人口。

sentences.english: The soldiers marched towards the capital of the enemy country.
sentences.chinese: 士兵們向敵國的首都進軍。

sentences.english: Second, be close with those he loves in order to fragment his awesomeness.
sentences.chinese: 二是拉攏敵君的近臣，以削弱敵國的力量。

sentences.english: Enemy states are no longer on the other side of the ocean, but just behind the firewall.
sentences.chinese: 敵國不在遙遠的大洋彼岸，而就在防火牆之後。

sentences.english: How did a family that once owned so much find itself in such a corner?
sentences.chinese: 這樣一個一度富可敵國的家族爲何陷入如此絕境？

sentences.english: This corporation is as wealthy as many nations.

definition: to be in overall charge/to oversee
strict law/cruel punishment/to carry out cruel law rigorously
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
running of armed forces/military management/to govern armed forces/to direct troops
to rise in revolt/to raise difficult questions
to have an audience (with the Emperor)
